Fields.DialogueText: Kapitan?
Yes, L-3?
We have detected a Morgana in the vicinity.
We have? Then why has no one sounded the alarm?
It has not spotted us in turn. Therefore, I think that we should attempt a stealth approach and ambush the enemy.
That's a little risky.
War is rife with danger, Kapitan. But the reward will be well worth it.
However, we need proper coordination for this to work. That is why I'm humbly requesting your permission.

Fields.MenuText: What if I say no?

Fields.DialogueText: I will obey accordingly. However, I feel that this is our best option.
Well, then... let's proceed.
Thank you, Kapitan.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to ask permission. I trust you to inform me of the best option.

Fields.DialogueText: Ponyatno. I will respect proper channels.

Fields.MenuText: Granted. Let's light them up.

Fields.DialogueText: We will see that they are snuffed out.
*ALARM*
They've detected us this time, I take it?
Da. They're already moving to intercept, Kapitan.
Don't let it rattle you. We can still pick our targets.
I am not easily rattled, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Excellent work, crew. Let's inspect the debris left by the Morgana and then move forward.
Understood, Kapitan. But might I make a suggestion?
Sure. What's that?
Try to avoid that area over there, on the port side. I believe that there are still mines floating beneath the surface there.
Thanks for the heads up, L-3. What happened over there?
Not much. I simply unloaded as many as I could afford.
I wish you would be a little more careful about using those things. Deployed mines are dangerous.
All weapons are dangerous. That doesn't mean we shouldn't utilize them.

Fields.MenuText: But the remaining mines could become a potential problem for people in the future.
I'm worried about the mines causing friendly fire.
I suppose you would know more than me, as this is one of your primary tactics.

Fields.DialogueText: Such speculation is worthless in the present. We must focus on the here and now to move the revolution forward.
That is a risk we will have to take. Even if I were to die by my own mine, it would be worth the measure in deterring the Morganas.
I appreciate your faith in my capabilities, Kapitan. Even so, I suggest that you conduct some research yourself, in case I were to fall in battle.
Well, at the very least, try to make sure that the minelaying is worth it. It's inefficient for all of those mines to go to waste.
That is a good point. Even so, they did manage to sink the Morganas. And who knows? They might sink some more, eventually.
I just hope it is them and not us. But enough. Let's move out! And take care to avoid the minefield.
No need to be so morbid, you know.
Good day, Kapitan. I have been keeping the patrol on schedule.
That's good to hear, L-3. But... are you truly comfortable like that?
Whatever do you mean?
I mean... your attire is a little... scant.
I assure you that my current level of armor is fully serviceable for my present needs as a weapon.
Are you sure? Won't you... catch cold?
I am a child of the Motherland. A slight chill hardly bothers me. And I shall never be embarrassed to give full tribute to my country.

Fields.MenuText: More armor would protect you to a greater degree during battle.
Some people might see you as being overly flashy with so little covering you.
Whatever makes you happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps, but it would also slow me down. I would prefer to make a dent on the enemy than worry about my own wounds. After all, I am but one cog in the system.
Ironic. I specifically restricted my clothing so as to not flaunt my strength.
This is not about my happiness, but I thank you for being considerate. I feel that this is the best way to stay true to my ideals.
Well, if you need any extra coverings, just let me know, all right?
Understood. But right now, there are bigger issues to deal with than physical appearance. I just detected a Morgana group closing in.
@BATTLE
You can't please everyone.
Hello, L-3. What are you working on there?
I am inspecting my torpedo reserves and ensuring that they are functioning properly.
Isn't that... kind of dangerous? You know what you're doing, don't you?
Of course I do, Kapitan. I'm simply double checking that everything is in order for each one and conducting repairs where necessary.
That still sounds risky.
Well, it is necessary under the circumstances. With our supplies limited, I need to make sure that every weapon works perfectly.
Do you think the Soviet Union would send you more supplies if you asked?
The Soviet Union has many mouths to feed. I am grateful for what I am given.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure they wouldn't mind if you asked for a little more.
I guess we all need to value what we have, then.
That doesn't stop you from using a lot of supplies in battle.

Fields.DialogueText: You do not know the Soviet Union, Kapitan.
Yes, it is important that we are grateful for what we are given and share it with others in turn.
That is why I want to be certain that the weapons work. If I use them, I want them to be effective.
Anyway, I must get back to work.
Got it. Keep up the good work.
*ALARM*
At least we know your ammunition is guaranteed to hit the enemy.
@BATTLE
In the case of a misplaced mine, I'd probably rather have it be a dud.
Kapitan, I have the report you wanted concerning the Morganas.
Thanks, Ellie. I really appreciate it.
Ellie? Who are you talking to?
L-3 doesn't exactly roll off the tongue. I thought I'd try a nickname.
I'm quite fond of L-3.
I know, but that sounds more like something you would give to a nail off the factory line, not a person.
I am a weapon and tool of the Soviet Union. My name was specifically shortened to such a designation to highlight that role.
You don't think that's kind of harsh?
It is reality. I know my purpose, and there is no need to add frivolous extensions to that function.

Fields.MenuText: Even so, it would make me more comfortable to call you by a real name.
You can refer to yourself as L-3, but please don't mind if I come up with my own name for you.
I just thought you might like a name more than a number.

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't my opinion the more important one on this subject?
I certainly will mind. This is my name, Kapitan, and I will not allow you to call me something without my permission.
That was an incorrect assumption on your part. You ought to ask my opinion, in the future.
My name has been changed on multiple occasions, in the past. I would like to keep my current name as long as I possibly can.
What were your previous names?
Bolshevik and Frunzenets. Losing those names... it wasn't easy.
I imagine it wasn't. And I apologize for attempting to give you a new one. L-3 you will be to me, from here on out.
Thank you, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Shall we, L-3?
Let us proceed.
I'm sorry, Kapitan. I believe the enemy has detected us.
Stealth is always worth a try.
Everyone, get ready for a brawl.
@BATTLE
Good work, everybody. Feel free to celebrate for the next few minutes.
I see. If you will please excuse me, I must see to the inventory and account for how much ammunition remains in stock.
You sure, L-3? You deserve a little reward yourself for doing so well out there.
My reward is seeing my successes strengthen the might of the Soviet Union.

Fields.MenuText: I thought it would be fun for us to have some time together outside of battle.
Relaxation is good for the soul, even those of soldiers.
You can afford to give yourself a little slack.

Fields.DialogueText: That would be nice, but my duties come first.
This is true, but too much relaxation can poison one's devotion to the ideal life.
Staying true to my cause is more important than giving myself slack.
Well, you can do what you like. I'm going to enjoy the party.
Wait. Who said I was not going to come at all?
But you said...
I have duties I must attend to before joining the crew, but once those duties are complete, I will mingle for a little while.
I'm glad to hear it, L-3.
Kapitan, the Morganas are positioning themselves for combat.
Good. Let's prepare to move in.
All right, here we go!
Hold on – and hold your fire, too.
What?
Look. I think a civilian ship got caught in the Morgana formation.
I see. What of it?
What of it? We need to help them!
No, we do not. Our responsibility is to destroy the Morganas, nothing more.
But they could get caught in the crossfire!
In that case, we will have to ensure that their sacrifice was not made in vain.
They may help us by temporarily distracting the Morganas. But we need to move in quickly to seize the day.

Fields.MenuText: It wouldn't put us in the best light if we refused to help them.
What if some of the people were from your home country?
We must set a positive moral example for the others.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't worry too much about that. A few accidents here and there can be covered up quite easily. It's the victories that people notice.
Then I would expect them to understand and comply with their duty to the cause.
Might determines morals. We need these victories to demonstrate our rising power. A few deaths along the way are inevitable.
L-3, we are going to work to protect the civilian craft. Understood?
Yes, Kapitan. I suppose this means I cannot use my mines.
Don't worry, I know you'll still do well. Let's move in!
@BATTLE
What are you working on over here, L-3?
I thought I would construct a few temporary shelters for the crew on deck. We've been having a lot of rain recently.
I see. I'm sure the crew appreciates the gesture. A place to rest will do them good.
Too much comfort promotes idleness, but there should at least be enough to support productive workers.
The architectural style of those shelters is interesting. What is it called?
Constructivist. It was quite common back in the 1920s and 30s.
Ah, yes, I know some of the other Soviet Belles are quite taken with that style as well.
Indeed. It is a style purified of aristocratic and bourgeois sentiments.

Fields.MenuText: From what I heard, though, that style's been ousted by the Stalinist approach.
I thought you disliked adding extra features to yourself.
It's kind of pretty.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I'm aware.
That is because I do not see the need to do things for my sole benefit. These modifications, on the other hand, will help others.
That's not the point. But... I'm glad you like it.
In any case, thanks for going to the effort, L-3.
You don't have to thank me. All living beings are to be granted basic protections in the coming age of the proletariat.
*ALARM*
Let's make sure the Morganas don't erase any of the progress we've made.
@BATTLE
What are you reading, L-3?
I am reading Krieg, a novel by a communist thinker in Germany – well, he was in Germany, until he had to leave.
I see. Mind if I take a look?
Go right ahead. Hopefully you can read German.
I didn't know that you could speak German.
I have worked to educate myself in multiple languages. After all, it is our goal to bring the communist ideal to the whole world. The people of each land are waiting for the coming age.
It must be an interesting book.
It gives another perspective on communist principles.

Fields.MenuText: It's a work of fiction, though.
Maybe you should try writing a book yourself.
What is the book about?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, and I realize that I am often dismissive of things that are not factual. Still, even fantasies have their role in inspiring people.
I do not think I would be the best person to do so. I am a soldier. I have no need for anything else in my life.
It is about an unknown soldier in the Great War. The way that even that simple soldier had determination in that fight shows the beauty of communal strength.
Well, I won't disturb you.
Thank you. I'm almost done with this chapter.
*ALARM*
Looks as though I'll have to finish it up later. We won't find battlefield glory on the printed page.
@BATTLE
Brrr!
What was that, L-3?
Nothing, Kapitan!
Are you sure? It sounded like you were shivering.
And if I was? I told you before, I am not putting on extra garments. They would simply slow me down.
Even so, you could at least move to one of the warmer rooms. That's what a lot of the others are doing.
That would be a dereliction of my responsibilities. I must remain alert at all times.
L-3, you need to rest now and then.
Perhaps, but no one can see me do so. My motherland is expecting me to set a strong example for all other comrades in this struggle.

Fields.MenuText: But you're not fighting this war all on your own. You have comrades to assist you in this fight. And none of them would fault you for resting in their sight.
Still, I don't like seeing you push yourself like that.
Then I'll keep it a secret between the two of us.

Fields.DialogueText: I still don't think that it would be a good idea.
I know what I'm capable of, Kapitan. I know how far I can push myself.
That is very nice of you, Kapitan, but... it is difficult for me to trust others to keep quiet.
Well, mind if I keep you company?
That would be nice. Thank you.
You're welcome.
*ALARM*
Sounds like things are about to heat up.
@BATTLE
There! That should do it!
What were you working on, L-3?
I am writing a report for my comrades in the Soviet government. They will be happy to learn of our recent victories.
That's good to hear. Why do you have two separate piles, there?
These are the original reports, and these are the edits I've made to those reports.
Huh? Wait, this didn't happen quite like that.
That's the point. Each victory needs to be presented in the proper light to encourage all people on the path to unity.
You don't think rewriting history might be taking things a little too far?
If it is, it is not my call to make.

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather you just take credit for the achievements you made rather than muddy them with fake successes as well.
What if they don't like you distorting the truth?
I think that the truth is the most important thing to consider.

Fields.DialogueText: I would as well, but I have to be realistic and acknowledge the influence my recorded actions will have on the coming generations. This is for the best.
That is a possibility, as they might want to have made the changes on their own. If so, I will loyally pay the price.
Possibly. Nevertheless, the truth is something that the common man does not comprehend until shown the light.
Well, at least you are keeping one factual record.
You may keep your own copy as well.
I will. We need to know what really happened when we look back on these days.
*ALARM*
I guess I will need to delay my report to include this latest skirmish.
@BATTLE
That's not exactly what I meant.
That's a nice picture, L-3. Who is it?
The late Mikhail Frunze, a key member of the party.
Late? Was he... ?
No, he died of natural causes. I think.
Was he your namesake, at one time?
Yes, he was. I was named in part to pay homage to his legacy.
Interesting. What was he like?
He was devoted to the cause to the very end. Though he came from Turkestan, he saw the wisdom of communism. In fact, his vision drives my own goal for this war.
What do you mean?
Mikhail called for unitary militarism. We will actively spread communism around the world.
By force?
By whatever means necessary. It is the destiny that awaits us all.

Fields.MenuText: Is that the majority opinion back in the U.S.S.R.?
I'm not sure that sort of policy will encourage people to truly support communism.
Is force really necessary to spread your ideas?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Opinion is varied, but our direction has been predetermined from the very beginning. One way or another, the revolution is coming.
There may be some disagreement at first, but that just means you have to hit hard when and where it counts. Just like any battle.
As if the capitalists would give us a chance otherwise. They've rigged the game. Yet they have been blinded to the possibility that, one day, we will not play by their rules.
There are other things about him that I like, as well.
That's good to know.
*ALARM*
You know, I wonder what sort of legacy you will leave behind.
My legacy matters little, so long as my life betters the Revolution as whole.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Give us all the speed you've got, L-3.
We've had reports of an aircraft carrier somewhere nearby, and I really don't want this group to rendezvous with it.
No need to explain, Kapitan.
No reason not to, either.
@BATTLE
The Morganas are taking damage, Kapitan, but we need to press the attack if we wish to succeed.
I know, but let's be careful. If we get too reckless, they might catch us off guard.
That's just a risk we will have to – ghh!
L-3! Are you okay?
I took a bit of damage there. I'd better get back to work.
Take it easy, there. Are you sure you don't want someone to take a look at you?
I'm not seeing any doctors!
What?
I apologize for my brusque reaction, but I will be fine, I assure you. This will heal naturally, given enough time.
Why are you so insistent on not being treated?
That is none of your business. Besides, I have a battle to win.

Fields.MenuText: If you won't accept treatment, please at least try to take better care of yourself.
I'm just worried about you.
Try to value your life more, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: I will see what I can do.
You really care about me that much? I... thank you.
My value is in my service to the Soviet Union. To live having failed would be unforgivable.
Well, you can stop for a checkup after the battle.
Thank you, but I will be all right.
If you say so. For now, we need to finish off these Morganas.
Looks like it's finally over, for now.
It is, isn't it?
So, who's up for some refreshments? I know that I am! You coming, L-3?
Yes, since you asked.
Great. Are you... feeling okay? You seem a little melancholic.
I am questioning whether I did my absolute best in that last fight.
Don't be so hard on yourself. We won.
Still, could I have done better?
What do you mean?
My current strategy has been to hit hard and fast. Standard procedure, nothing new about it.
Yes, that does appear to be your style.
But sometimes I wonder if I should be more unorthodox. More... like my namesake.
You mean Frunze?
Yes. He was noted for unorthodox ideas that he applied to the battlefield. I wonder... which path should I follow?

Fields.MenuText: From how you have described him, he sounded pretty militaristic.
Just go with whatever style suits you the best.
Sometimes it's good to reinvent yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: True enough. But there was more to him than just that.
That... is a difficult decision to make. But I'll try.
Yes, that does fit with the cycle of revolution. I'm not sure if it is my decision to make, though.
In any case, you're a strong person, L-3. I'll support you no matter what decision you make.
Thanks, Kapitan.
So come on, the party's just getting started.
What are you looking at, L-3?
Just staring out into the abyss.
Yes, it is awfully dark down here, isn't it?
Indeed.
Do you ever wonder what creatures lurk beneath us?
I do, but does it matter?
What do you mean?
Everything I know is what has been taught and ingrained into me. Anything else which would distract me from those teachings is unnecessary.
L-3, I think you sometimes get a little too worked up on things like this. There is more than one way to see the world, after all.
But only one way is right. And I am afraid of what will befall me if, someday, I choose the wrong path.

Fields.MenuText: Just take some time to think about what you want for yourself in life.
We all have choices we must make in life. All we can do is make the best decision we can and keep moving forward.
Just don't fear the future to such an extent that you find yourself unable to make a choice.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I really need to think things over. Luckily, out here in the abyss, I might have enough peace and safety to do just that.
An interesting outlook, Kapitan.
Wise words, Kapitan.
You have to understand, Kapitan, that I am loyal to my homeland. It is difficult to break away from their given wisdom.
I understand. Then again, there's a lot they – and everybody else – have yet to learn. After all, do any of them know what creatures lurk under the sea?
A good point. I don't know yet what path I will choose, but I will choose one soon enough.
*ALARM*
I guess our peace and quiet is over. Once more into the fray, then.
@BATTLE
L-3, we're getting assembled for the raid on the Morgana fleet, just to let you know.
Thank you, Kapitan. Actually, do you mind if I speak to some of the crew?
I don't see any reason why not. But why?
This is going to be a difficult battle. I can feel it. I want to make sure their morale is high.
Do you think you can do that?
Trust me.
Well, all right then. Give it your best shot.
Comrades! Both new and old. We have come from many different lands, lands we may never see again. Every day brings with it new challenges, new threats.
No matter what happens today, we must have faith, in the world and in each other. Let us take satisfaction in ourselves, knowing we've fought the good fight.
That was... pretty good, L-3.
You sound surprised.

Fields.MenuText: I was just impressed with how well you motivated them.
I was a little worried, I'll admit. You're usually a little morbid.
I'm happy that you are getting along well with everyone.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I do my best to inspire people through my words and actions.
War requires some morbidity, but that doesn't mean that's what our crew needed to hear at this moment.
Of course! We are all common brothers and sisters, even if we have yet to fully understand our common purpose together.
In any case, words only do so much. Victory is what counts the most.
I know. So let's do our best.
@BATTLE
Ah, Kapitan. I was just about to play a game of chess.
By yourself?
I have to make do. It's somewhat like solitaire in that way.
I see. So I suppose you always win.
And lose. Each game gives me the opportunity to improve my ability.
Would you care to play against me?
Me?
Yes, if you have the time. I am interested in seeing what it is like to face you in battle from the opposite side.

Fields.MenuText: I should warn you, I'm just a beginner.
Preparing in case we have to fight against one another someday, eh?
Sure, it sounds like fun.

Fields.DialogueText: That is all right. You have to take risks to move forward and grow stronger.
Don't joke about that! If things turned out that way, I...
I think it will be!
Well, it looks like you'll start.
There. Now it's your move.
Check...
What? It's too early to have me in check.
Check your scanners. I think we're going to have to postpone the game.
@BATTLE
I'm sorry.
*ALARM*
Well, it looks like we have some Morganas in sight, L-3.
All boxed together. Perfect. But we will need the right tactics to win.
True. They never make things easy for us.
So, then, what are your orders, Kapitan?
I'm not sure you need me to direct you that much. You usually figure things out on your own.
You know that I prefer to follow protocol in such matters.
Even so, I want you to decide some things for yourself.
I'll try that, but... it's kind of silly, but I enjoy working together with you.
Ah. In that case, it looks like you've already made a decision. I'll see if I can come up with one myself.

Fields.MenuText: Set up a chokehold with your mines.
Launch some torpedoes as the vanguard.
Close in for the kill.

Fields.DialogueText: Roger that. They won't get away this time.
Good idea. And I'll keep some extra for a second wave, too.
Da. This will be good. Now for them to face the justice of the revolution!
Satisfied with my command?
I am, Kapitan.
Good to hear. Now let's get moving! There's no time to waste!
@BATTLE
What's going on in here, L-3? I smell smoke.
Izvineniya, Kapitan. There was a minor accident with the grill.
Oh, I see. But what were you doing with it?
I thought I would try to cook up something.
Really? I thought you disliked “frivolous things” like that.
Well, yes, but a few rewards now and then are good for motivating people. So I thought I would whip up something to celebrate our next victory.
That sounds great. What are you cooking?
That is the difficult part. I am not quite sure what I should make.

Fields.MenuText: Try something that is traditional from your country.
Go for something that suits the flavor you like most.
Think about what the purpose is for the food.

Fields.DialogueText: That is a little difficult, but I'll see what I can do.
Well, I don't have much preference, but I do like having a cigar now and then. So how about I smoke the food?
Hmm... I want something with utility yet dignity.
Thank you, Kapitan. I think I have a better idea, now.
Great. By the way, feel free to have some of the food yourself. You deserve a reward, too.
Maybe just a little.
*ALARM*
Well, here comes the battle, so hopefully there will be a victory – and feast – right behind it.
@BATTLE
Without tobacco, I hope.
*ALARM*
These numbers aren't ideal.
Nyet. But since there are reports of another battle group nearby...
I know, I know. It'll be worse later if we're not effective now.
@BATTLE
You okay, L-3? I don't know what we got with, but I'm not sure I've ever heard the sub groan like this before.
It's just something I'll have to – ah! ...deal with.
L-3! Hang on, I'm here for you!
It's okay. I'm... going to get back on my feet soon.
Look, I really think we should have someone see to you...
No, no, I'm fine!
But I'm worried about you! This injury looks worse than the last.
That's the point! I can't let them get their hands on me!
L-3, why are you so afraid?
Mikhail had an ulcer, but he refused to have it operated on. Finally, he was convinced to allow doctors to treat it... and that was the end for him.
If I'm going to die, it will be on my feet, not down on a bed.

Fields.MenuText: No matter what, you won't die alone.
Okay, I'll respect your decision.
Just because it happened to your namesake doesn't mean it will happen to you.

Fields.DialogueText: You'll be there?
You believe in me, even now? Thank you, Kapitan.
I suppose... that could be correct.
Perhaps... after the battle... I'll see someone about my injuries. But right now, we don't have the time.
I guess you're right. Just try not to push yourself.
Yes, I will.
Thank you, Kapitan.
Hey, L-3? I got you this book, if you're interested.
Perhaps. What is it?
It is a book about the Koga clan of ninja. They were infamous in particular for a raid they launched in a snowstorm. The story reminded me of you.
I would rather not be compared to some Japanese grunts of a feudalistic society.
Sorry. I just thought you might appreciate their tactics, as they were stealthy and ruthless.
That is a decent point. But the Japanese are so uneducated on matters of class consciousness. They hardly have any concept of the revolution.

Fields.MenuText: Then use this to better understand their mindset.
You can just focus on their tactics, rather than their political beliefs, if that helps.
I can keep it secret.

Fields.DialogueText: As preemptive planning? Good idea.
True, but it's what other people might think if they see me reading that book that worries me.
Someone will find out. They always do.
Sorry. I just thought this would be a nice present.
I appreciate the thought, but you didn't need to get me anything.
I know, but I wanted to.
... I guess I'll take a look at it.
*ALARM*
These Morganas are like ninjas themselves.
@BATTLE
You certainly keep busy.
I thought I'd clean up some of the crew's quarters. I want everyone to rest easy between assignments.
You know, for all your ruthlessness on the field, you really care about the people aboard this sub, don't you?
That is a basic principle of communism. Everyone deserves basic support to live. The trouble is that some people do not accept the help until force is applied.
Hence your treatment of our enemies. But the same doesn't apply to us?
Of course. We are all comrades. I am happy that we can all share in the workers' path to the future.

Fields.MenuText: Not all of us agree on that vision, though.
You have great compassion for the world.
If you treat them as enemies, they might stay enemies.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't? I... thought we were friends.
Thank you. We can all do our part to bring unity and peace to mankind.
That's all right. If they're wiped out, then there will be no enemies, right?
Have you considered sharing your ideas with others? Beyond the general policies, I mean. If you explained it from the heart, I think more people would listen.
Hmm... that is something to consider.
*ALARM*
The proletariat cannot rest. I'm ready to fight, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
We are, L-3. We just don't always agree on things.
... That's one way to look at it.
Cold, isn't it, L-3?
It is warm compared to Mother Russia.
Even so, I see that you are shivering as well.
... Maybe a little.
It wouldn't kill you to use some sort of covering, you know.
Actually, Kapitan, do you have a blanket we could huddle under?
We?
Yes. I think it would be most efficient for us to share our body heat accordingly.
But like that?
Why? What's so strange about it?
Nothing.
So do you think we could find a blanket?

Fields.MenuText: We could try making one.
Sure. Friends stick together, right?
We could always warm ourselves by a furnace, too.

Fields.DialogueText: That would take a while, but it would make a greater difference in the long run. You have the mark of an industrious worker, Kapitan.
Yes, exactly. Being with you makes me feel at ease.
Yes, that is another option. Still, I like the sound of a blanket.
Okay, I'll go fetch a blanket, and then...
*ALARM*
So much for that idea. Ready to fight, L-3?
I always am ready.
@BATTLE
Well... I'd better get started, huh?
Started on what, exactly?
Wah! Oh, Kapitan, it's you!
Something the matter? You usually aren't that easily startled.
I was just a little... restless. I did not wish to be disturbed while I was working on writing.
Ah, I understand. Are you going to write down some of your ideas for communism?
Not so loud! I... would like the topic to remain private, for the moment.
Oh, you don't think your government will approve?
They might approve. But... for now, it may be best to wait until I have a finished product.

Fields.MenuText: What will you do when you publish it, though?
Don't be afraid to speak what you believe in.
I'm proud of you for taking this step, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: I will live with my actions and be rewarded or punished as fate allows.
Yes, I cannot back down. I will stay strong to the end.
Thank you, Kapitan. I need to have faith that I can find the truth of this world, and bring that truth to light.
I'm going to make some backup copies, once I've finished.
That's probably for the best.
Would you mind... carrying one of them with you when I finish?
I'd be happy to, L-3. I look forward to reading it.
My time awake has opened my eyes to new worlds, new ways for us to come together as one.
*ALARM*
Together, we will push back the ignorance and ghosts of past sorrows.
@BATTLE
I have checked, and all of the Morganas have fled the area. We may rest easy for the moment.
That's good. Care to celebrate?
Yes, but could we go somewhere private, please? I want to talk to you about something.
All right...
So, what is it?
I wanted to say that I am sorry.
Is this about your performance? I've told you, you shouldn't be ashamed of yourself.
No, it's not that. I wanted to apologize for how I have been acting. I am kind of... opinionated.
I know, but I've gotten used to it. That's just part of who you are.
Who I am, and who I serve. But now, I'm starting to question things. I don't know what to do anymore. That's where I need your help.
My help?
Yes, you. I admire your willingness to try new things, so I am hoping that we can work together to strengthen our bond and grow as a team.

Fields.MenuText: I'll definitely be here to help you figure things out, L-3.
To be honest, you've changed me a lot as well, L-3.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kapitan. I really appreciate having a true friend like you.
In that case, I look forward to seeing where our two paths continue to go. Together.
Thank you, Kapitan, for being here for me.
Well, let's get started with that journey of discovery, shall we?
Yes, the party has only just begun, and I have some surprises just right for the occasion.
Enemy in sight! Brace yourselves, people - we can't take our time with this one!
@BATTLE
